page.title: 19THE DIALSTONE CENTRE
page.content: The Dialstone Centre was built as a school in 1934. It remained a school for 49 years and then in 1983, because of falling rolls at the school and at the neighbouring Goyt Bank Comprehensive, the two schools were amalgamated to form{Offerton High {School.}This new school occupies the former Goyt Bank site. The old {Dialstone School}once held over 1000 pupils and nearly 60 staff. The Centre's new main use is as a {Teachers' Centre}with a{Youth Club being held on two weekday evenings. The Sports Hall and gymnasium are often booked by local clubs but there are plans to further develop these sports facilities and it is to be designated a 'centre of excellence' for gymnastics. A library may be opened here in a few years time.
